wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: a:9:{i:0;s:34:"frank Lounge – $15,000";i:1535916277438;s:33:"Content Block Sponsor – $15,000";i:1535916278137;s:46:"The frank Puzzle Hunt – $15,000 ";i:1535916279315;s:41:"Tuesday Night Welcome Rally – $12,000 ";i:1535916506280;s:51:"Wednesday Connector’s Lunch Sponsor – $10,000 ";i:1535916527319;s:36:"Thursday Lunch Sponsor – $10,000 ";i:1535916527986;s:38:"frank After Party – $10,000";i:1535916528629;s:36:"The Daily frank – $5000";i:1535916529376;s:40:"frank Lounge Snacks – $5,000";}

a:9:{i:0;s:949:"The frank lounge provides an informal space where our attendees can connect with others and where speakers hold office hours. Each year, the frank lounge reflects our theme and is filled with prompts that help our participants think about how the theme might influence their work. Located in the basement of the Hippodrome Theatre, the lounge provides a comfortable space for franksters to connect in between Main Stage performances, grab a coffee or a snack, or make a quick phone call. All the Main Stage talks are live streamed onto the lounge’s four monitors. For your support:
  • Signage display to acknowledge support of the lounge
  • Name listed on materials and displays as conference sponsor at frank
  • Logo (linked) featured prominently on Sponsors page on conference website
  • Recognition of support on frank social media channels
";i:1535916277438;s:749:"The frank gathering features only plenary sessions which are grouped by a content theme. We schedule speakers to align their talks with the theme of each content block. In 2018, there will be seven blocks and we will work with you to identify the theme that best fits your foundation’s mission. For your support:
  • Acknowledgment of sponsorship during the live stream and on the archived video recording
  • Name listed on the program directly under the title of the content block
  • Name listed on materials and displays as conference sponsor at frank
  • Logo (linked) featured prominently on Sponsors page on conference website
  • Recognition of support on frank social media channels
";i:1535916278137;s:930:"Inspired by the Washington Post Hunt, this event takes place on Thursday night and a ticket to play will be included in every frankster’s registration. People from the Gainesville community will be able to register to join the hunt as well. Designed around the theme of play, participants will be given two hours to search the downtown area for clues to help them solve the puzzles. The evening will end with a reveal of the winners, an award ceremony and a celebration at a venue downtown. For your support:
  • Recognition of sponsorship on the hunt registration page
  • Acknowledgment of sponsorship at the final meet up location
  • Name listed on materials and displays as conference sponsor at frank
  • Logo (linked) featured prominently on Sponsors page on conference website
  • Recognition of support on frank social media channels
";i:1535916279315;s:836:"Located at the Boxcar Wine and Cheese Garden, a restored train depot in downtown Gainesville, the Welcome Rally gives franksters a chance to meet up with old friends and connect with new ones. frank connectors will be on hand to spark conversations and collaborations. Drinks and hors d’oeuvres will be served. All registered franksters and community friends of frank will be in attendance. For your support:
  • Signage display to acknowledge support of the reception.
  • Name listed on materials and displays as conference sponsor at frank
  • Logo (linked) featured prominently on Sponsors page on conference website
  • Recognition of support on frank social media channels
  • Our thanks printed on cocktail napkins
";i:1535916506280;s:473:"Located inside the historic Woolworth, the buffet-style lunch is served before the official Opening Ceremonies of frank and is included with all franksters’ registration. For your support:
  • Designated as official sponsor of Connector’s Lunch, with signage displayed at the venue
  • Logo featured on sponsors page on conference website
  • Recognition of support of frank social media channels
";i:1535916527319;s:422:"Provided by a local caterer and using locally sourced foods whenever possible, Thursday lunch is included with all franksters’ registration. For your support:
  • Designated as official sponsor Thursday Lunch, with signage displayed at the venue
  • Logo featured on Sponsors page on conference website
  • Recognition of support on frank social media channels
";i:1535916527986;s:439:"Whether it’s tacos and margaritas at the Wooly or franks and bubbles outside the Hipp, our after party is a time to say goodbye, reflect and celebrate. For your support:
  • Designated as official sponsor of frank After Party, with signage displayed at the venue
  • Logo featured on Sponsors page on conference website
  • Recognition of support of frank social media channels
";i:1535916528629;s:470:"The Daily frank is the community newspaper of the frank gathering. It includes daily highlights, weather reports, and updates on local restaurant specials. For your support:
  • Designated as official sponsor of the Daily frank, with our gratitude expressed in every issue
  • Logo featured on Sponsors page on conference website
  • Recognition of support of frank social media channels
";i:1535916529376;s:697:"Provide nourishing snacks and coffee to all franksters in the frank lounge.  Food and coffee will be sourced locally whenever possible. The lounge is open for 3 three days, from 9 am to 5 pm and all registered franksters have unlimited access. For your support:
  • Recognition of sponsorship on the hunt registration page
  • Acknowledgment of sponsorship at the final meet up location
  • Name listed on materials and displays as conference sponsor at frank
  • Logo (linked) featured prominently on Sponsors page on conference website
  • Recognition of support on frank social media
";}

a:5:{i:1535919633381;s:35:"Who are frank ambassadors?";i:1535919633822;s:49:"Do I have to be a UF student to be an ambassador?";i:1535919634233;s:43:"What do I have to do before the conference?";i:1535922373225;s:43:"What are the volunteer positions available?";i:1538099429605;s:49:"Other things I should know as a frank ambassador:";}

a:5:{i:1535919633381;s:449:"frank ambassadors are motivated, passionate students seeking to be a part of one of the top nonprofit conferences in the nation. Volunteers are professional, creative and eager to represent the frank brand as well as the College of Journalism and Communications and the University of Florida. We seek out terrific ambassadors – about 150 of them each year. Without them, frank would simply not be the success that it is.";i:1535919633822;s:513:"No, you can volunteer for a position if you attend another university. We have even had a few high school seniors serve as ambassadors. The one requirement to be a volunteer is that you must currently be enrolled as a student. We encourage you to be an ambassador for at least one year before you register as an attendee. If it’s your senior year and this is your first time hearing about frank, you can request an invitation to attend here.";i:1535919634233;s:341:"There will be a series of meetings that you will be required to attend before the conference. These meetings are designed to get you acquainted with the frank brand and to help train you in your volunteer position. You will have an opportunity to sign up for more than one position and are encouraged to have more than one shift if possible.";i:1535922373225;s:3608:"Registration: Registration for franksters takes place in the conference room on the 2nd floor of the Hampton Inn Downtown Hotel. You will welcome guests, check them in using Eventbrite software, get them their program, make sure they get their freebies, and answer any questions they have about the area. Requirements: You serve as the front line of our team in the registration room. You must be able to work under pressure, answer numerous questions, think on your feet and multitask! Registration Set up: On the load in and load out days, you will help unpack all the boxes full of freebies, programs, nametags, computers, etc. and assist in setting up the registration room. Requirements: This work does not require heavy lifting. Many of the people who set up usually volunteer to work registration as well. Usher: As an usher, you will not only help people find their seat. You will also help show people out in case of an emergency. Think of them as flight attendants on the ground! Requirements: Attend a training session with the frank team. Frank lounge set up & take down You will help arrange the furniture and decorations in the frank lounge, located in the basement of the Hippodrome. Requirements: If you are a HGTV fan and a DIY-type, this job is for you! Frank lounge The frank lounge is open each day during the sessions on the mainstage at the Hippodrome. All the mainstage talks are streamed on to the TVs in the lounge so franksters may take a break to visit the lounge for coffee and snacks or to catch up on their emails. If you work the lounge, you will be responsible for keeping it tidy throughout the day, brewing coffee, replenishing snacks, keeping it relatively quiet (so people can work or listen to the live stream) and be available to answer questions from attendees and speakers. Requirements: Lounge ambassadors should enjoy hospitality work and know (or learn) how to make coffee. Frank store We sell our vintage frank swag as well as other other fun things in the frank store, which is located in the frank lounge in the bottom of the Hippodrome. Requirements: Volunteers in this position should have experience working in retail or a position requiring money handling. You will be responsible for setting up a creative table display and handling credit card or cash transactions. Recess/Social Media Recess takes place in the area coffee shops and restaurants. They are hour long breaks where franksters gathering by topic to discuss things in more detail or where they can learn new skills. If you volunteer to work these sessions, you will be asked to lead the franksters to the location of the recess and then stay for the session and use social media to report on the session. Requirements: You should be familiar with downtown Gainesville as well as have a Twitter account and know how to use it. Evening Event Help We will have an evening welcome reception Tuesday, Feb. 5 and an evening party on Wednesday, Feb 6. We will need ambassadors for at each of these events to help with ticket distribution, set up and various activities. This is normally a great opportunity to mingle with franksters. You will not be responsible for serving any food or cleaning up the location. Requirements: You don’t mind working at night!";i:1538099429605;s:767:"
  • There will be a dress code.
  • You will need to get downtown on your own.
  • If you aren’t familiar with downtown Gainesville, you should get to know it somewhat before the conference. This way you can speak knowledgeably when franksters ask you for advice on a restaurant, directions, or the like.
  • If you miss a shift, you must let the person in charge know.
  • You will have an opportunity to network – do your research on the franksters. The list is posted on our website and updated frequently.
  • You should have your own business cards.
  • While you are not allowed to directly ask for jobs, you can cultivate conversations and connections that may lead to jobs in the future.
";}

a:12:{i:1536185231546;s:56:"This is my first frank. What do I need to know?";i:0;s:27:"When do I need to be there?";i:1536185230256;s:40:"What is included in my registration fee?";i:1536185230786;s:40:"Is my registration/ticket transferrable?";i:1536185231917;s:41:"Can I update my registration information?";i:1536195969783;s:25:"What if I need to cancel?";i:1536185231177;s:25:"Where do I book my hotel?";i:1536195970328;s:27:"How can I become a sponsor?";i:1536185232274;s:20:"What is Changeville?";i:1536195969161;s:31:"What is frank scholar?";i:1536195970866;s:46:"Arriving early or staying after the gathering?";i:1536196208004;s:53:"Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?";}

a:12:{i:1536185231546;s:330:"At frank you’ll connect to an instant community. We will have frank connectors on hand to help with your gathering questions, navigate the Recess sessions, expand your network and even recommend the best place to find chicken and waffles. A Facebook group will get you started before you arrive in Gainesville.";i:0;s:421:"frank is about community. You’ll want to be here from the moment we gather until our last goodbye. Shared experiences are amplified, creating a vulnerability that helps establish deep meaningful connections. The gathering opens with a Welcome Rally on Tuesday, Feb. 5, 2018. We end with a goodbye party Friday, Feb. 8th. Make your travel plans accordingly! Don’t forget – Changeville is Feb. 7 & 8.";i:1536185230256;s:843:"
  • Tuesday: Welcome Rally featuring cocktails and hors d’oeuvres, Depot Park and Boxcar Wine & Beer Garden
  • Wednesday: Lunch and evening social
  • Thursday: Lunch and evening social
  • Friday: Farewell after-party
  • Coffee bucks and drink tickets, valid at area coffee shops and restaurants
  • New friends and instant community
  • Florida in February
  • Access to all frank sessions in the Hippodrome Theatre
  • Access to all frank social events
  • Access to all Recess (breakout) sessions: Play, Apply, Dissect and Study
  • Access to the frank lounge
  • Discount to Changeville
";i:1536185230786;s:289:"You have received a personal invitation to join us at frank. You may not transfer your ticket to someone else, without first letting us know. Please contact us at frankgathering@gmail.com.";i:1536185231917;s:222:"Yes! If you want to change or add any details and don’t have an Eventbrite account, simply email us at frankgathering@gmail.com.";i:1536195969783;s:308:"We hate to see you go, but if your plans change:
  • Until Nov. 1, 2018 - order cancellations will be processed at full price.
  • Nov. 1- Jan 1, 2019 – 50 percent refund
  • After Jan. 1 , 2019- No refunds processed, but we will happily hold your ticket for frank2020.
";i:1536185231177;s:1747:"The Hampton Inn Downtown continues to be the frank headquarters. We have a block rate at the new AC Marriott and at the Holiday Inn University. We provide shuttle service from both of those hotels. Hampton Inn & Suites Downtown Gainesville
  • Pick dates and use the code: F19
AC Marriott: Book your group rate for FRANK Conference Holiday Inn University: Book your group rate for FRANK Conference THERE WILL BE NO SHUTTLE SERVICE FROM THE HILTON UNIVERSITY.";i:1536195970328;s:993:"We are hugely grateful to our supporters. They provide critical support that makes it possible to offer our participants a more affordable registration fee as well as supporting the work of the frank online community. Our  past partners include:
  • Robert Wood Johnson Foundation
  • The Joy McCann Founation
  • Atlantic Philanthropies
  • Al and Nancy Burnett Charitable Foundation
  • Sarasota Community Foundation
  • The Karel Endowment for Public Interest Communications
  • Neimand Collaborative
  • UF College of Journalism and Communications
  • Visit Gainesville
We need more people and organizations like them to keep this work going. Learn more about sponsorship opportunities. Contact us at frankgathering@gmail.com.";i:1536185232274;s:333:"With the mission of cultivating connections between artists, influencers and activists, Changeville is a festival that showcases and connects those who use music, comedy, film, virtual reality and storytelling as a vehicle to drive self-awareness and social change.";i:1536195969161;s:285:"frankscholar is an academic conference designed to cultivate research that will inform your practice and ignite lasting behavioral, institutional and social change. This year, frank scholar will be woven into the fabric of the frank gathering and take place during the recess sessions.";i:1536195970866;s:161:"Check out all the things Gainesville and Alachua County offer at Visit Gainesville!";i:1536196208004;s:70:"frankgathering@gmail.com";}
